metadata.Title: CVE-2017-11145 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
In PHP before 5.6.31, 7.x before 7.0.21, and 7.1.x before 7.1.7, an errorin the date extension's timelib_meridian parsing code could be used byattackers able to supply date strings to leak information from theinterpreter, related to ext/date/lib/parse_date.c out-of-bounds readsaffecting the php_parse_date function. NOTE: the correct fix is in thee8b7698f5ee757ce2c8bd10a192a491a498f891c commit, not thebd77ac90d3bdf31ce2a5251ad92e9e75 gist.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-11145` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-php5 - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.22
libapache2-mod-php5filter - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.22
libphp5-embed - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.22
php-pear - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.22
php5 - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.22
php5-cgi - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.22
php5-cli - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.22
php5-common - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.22
php5-curl - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.22
php5-enchant - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.22
php5-fpm - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.22
php5-gd - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.22
php5-gmp - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.22
php5-intl - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.22
php5-ldap - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.22
php5-mysql - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.22
php5-mysqlnd - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.22
php5-odbc - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.22
php5-pgsql - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.22
php5-pspell - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.22
php5-readline - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.22
php5-recode - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.22
php5-snmp - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.22
php5-sqlite - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.22
php5-sybase - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.22
php5-tidy - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.22
php5-xmlrpc - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.22
php5-xsl - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.22
No subscription required

criterions.comment: php5 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.22').
